title: The EU and the UK diverge in strategies to regulate AI
description: On October 24, the EU aims to finalize the Artificial Intelligence Act. In November, the UK and Japan will host AI summits. However, despite their shared interest in AI, national strategies vary.

title: Rothko at the Louis Vuitton Foundation: When color pulsates
description: The Paris exhibition, spanning from October 18, 2023, to April 2, 2024, faithfully embodies the American painter's approach. Coherent rooms, low-hanging paintings and excellent lighting create a remarkable sensory experience for visitors.

title: French police detain two suspects linked to Brussels shooting
description: The suspects, who reside in the Paris region, appeared before a judge on Monday to assess the possibility of charging them with belonging to a terrorist organization.

title: Hamas releases two more hostages from Gaza
description: The International Committee of the Red Cross said Monday that it facilitated the release of two more hostages identified as Yocheved Lifshitz and Nurit Cooper.

title: UN General Assembly to meet over Israel-Hamas war on Thursday
description: The Security Council has so far failed to agree on a resolution concerning the war.

title: Risk of regional escalation raises tension on Israel-Lebanon border
description: Israel has begun evacuating several communities in the area, while deploying tanks and carrying out air strikes. On the other side, Hezbollah has mobilized tens of thousands of men and is firing rockets and shells. One slip, one misfire, could start a fire that both sides would prefer to avoid.

title: Macron to call for 'resumption of a genuine peace process' on Israel visit
description: The French president will call for the 'resumption of a genuine peace process' for the creation of a Palestinian state during his visit, during which he will meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: UN departs new base in Mali's tense Kidal region
description: The UN's withdrawal on Monday is the second in the Kidal region and the seventh in the country.

title: Keeping up the pressure to combat tax evasion
description: Going forward, multinational companies will pay a minimum tax rate of 15% regardless of where they declare profits. This is far from perfect, but it is a clear step in restoring equity to a system that governments have let slide for too long.

title: France announces sale of weapons to Armenia
description: Yerevan has agreed to purchase radar systems from the French group Thales amid fears that Azerbaijan might seek to target southern Armenia, after having seized Nagorno-Karabakh.

title: American autoworkers union expands strike, shuts down Stellantis plant
description: United Auto Workers has been on strike since September 15, shutting down Ford, General Motors, and Stellantis factories, and has received President Biden's support.

title: Roshdi Sarraj, Palestinian journalist and fixer, killed by Israeli strike in Gaza
description: The 31-year-old worked for the press and international NGOs for over ten years, including with Le Monde. Nearly 20 journalists have been killed in Gaza since October 7.

title: Argentina: Peronist candidate Sergio Massa holds back the far-right wave
description: In Sunday's first round of the Argentinian presidential election, the center-left coalition candidate, Sergio Massa, beat the outsider Javier Milei. They will compete in a second round on November 19.

title: Michel Duclos, former French ambassador: 'In a world without rules, all frozen conflicts risk erupting'
description: Noting that the use of force is no longer taboo, the former diplomat argues for an acceleration of dialogue between the Global North and South in order to strengthen global security.

title: 1$ trillion in 2022: Multinationals continue shifting their profits to tax havens
description: Despite an agreement on a global minimum corporate tax, multinational companies still transfer significant profits to tax havens, according to an EU Tax Observatory report.

title: Assemblée Nationale president accuses Mélenchon of putting 'target on my back' after Israel visit
description: Yaël Braun-Pivet, the president of France's Assemblée Nationale, denounced the words used by left-wing leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon to criticize her visit to Israel following the attacks by Hamas.

title: France's largest demonstration of solidarity with Palestine since start of war in Gaza goes off peacefully
description: Organizers counted some 30,000 participants at the rally in Paris, the first authorized since the start of the war.

title: Despite numerous international commitments, deforestation still increased by 4% in 2022
description: In addition to deforestation, the degradation of forest ecosystems due to the consequences of climate change and timber harvesting had a major impact.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Cairo summit calls for humanitarian aid amid acute divisions between Europeans and Arabs
description: The summit held in Egypt on Saturday failed to produce a joint declaration. Cairo denounced the West's 'incomprehensible hesitation' to condemn the deaths of Palestinian civilians under Israeli bombardment.

title: Philippines summons China's ambassador over south China sea collisions
description: Two collisions occurred on Sunday in the disputed Spratly Islands, near Second Thomas Shoal, a region where Beijing deploys its vessels to assert control over nearly the entire South China Sea.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Settlers speed up eviction of Palestinian Bedouins in West Bank hills amid war
description: Hundreds of Palestinian Bedouins are being driven off their land in a displacement strategy orchestrated by Israeli settlers since 2017, which has been accelerating discreetly since October 7.

title: Argentina: Economy Minister Sergio Massa and outsider Javier Milei head to runoff presidential election
description: With 76% of the votes counted, Sergio Massa had 35.2%, compared to the anti-establishment candidate Javier Milei's 30.5%, meaning the two were poised to face off in a November second round.

title: In Kyiv, escapism via the big screen
description: Despite the ongoing war, a film festival in the Ukrainian capital sold-out, offering audiences an escape from the harsh realities of everyday life.

title: French government accused of 'stalling' on response to summer urban riots
description: After postponing her announcement, Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne is due to present measures for working-class neighborhoods at the end of October.

title: Switzerland's right-wing Swiss People's Party dominates general election in early projections
description: With more than half of the results in, the populist Swiss People's Party (SVP) took 29 percent of the vote in elections to the lower house of parliament, riding on a platform focused on immigration and opposition to 'woke culture.'

title: Avoiding the Hamas trap in Gaza
description: Hamas is banking on the revolutionary unrest that a bloodbath in Gaza could spark off in Jordan, Egypt and the rest of the Arab world.
